definition: to play dirty tricks/to be up to mischief
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: And there lies another source of sourness.
sentences.chinese: 此外还存在另一种使坏的根源。

sentences.english: Confront those who have hurt you; tell them how you feel.
sentences.chinese: 面对面向那个使坏的人，说出你的感受。

sentences.english: Shuagushihuai who will not only gentlemanly disdain it.
sentences.chinese: 耍滑使坏谁不会，只是君子不屑为之。

definition: to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
lit. to strike with a muckrake (idiom), cf Pigsy 豬八戒|猪八戒 in Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记; fig. to counterattack/to make bogus accusations (against one's victim)
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
to throw stones at sb who fell down a well (idiom); to hit a person who is down
